annotations.summary: Patient is experiencing persistent cough with shortness of breath for three weeks.
Cough started approximately three weeks ago and has been worsening.
Cough is mostly dry with occasional yellowish mucus production.
Patient has been experiencing low-grade fevers around 99-100 degrees.
Patient reports chest pain with deep breathing during coughing.
Patient is a former smoker who quit two years ago after 15 years. Coworker was recently sick with similar symptoms.
Patient takes lisinopril for blood pressure and has seasonal pollen allergy.
Blood pressure readings around 130/85, checked weekly at home.
Patient experiences nocturnal dyspnea, waking up at night with difficulty breathing.
Decreased appetite but no noticeable weight loss.
No recent travel but occupational dust exposure in warehouse work environment.
